name: 3.17 "The Mail Goes to Jail" Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 3 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Why was it so cold at Cheers?
questions.correct: The heater was not working right
options: The heat hadn't been turned on yet
questions.explanation:
The heater was not working right.

	Winter in Boston, Massachusetts gets very cold since they are located up north. The heater broke and no one could come to fix it right away.

Cliff.

	Cliff had a bad cold. As a result he could not deliver the mail.

Norm.

	Norm was arrested for tampering with the mail. He was trying to be a good friend and help Cliff out.

questions.text: How did Sam try to fix the problem with the heater?
questions.correct: He shined a flashlight on it.
options: He had Diane fix it since she was smarter.
He hired someone to come fix it.
questions.explanation:
He shined a flashlight on it.

	Sam said that usually shining a flashlight worked. Diane couldn't believe no one would even try to fix the heater.

questions.text: When Cliff said "My whole career could hang in the balance", how did Carla respond?
questions.correct: "I'd like to hang you in a balance."
options: "Fix this problem or I'll fix you."
questions.explanation:
"I'd like to hang you in a balance."

	Carla never liked Cliff. This situation just made her dislike him even more.

questions.text: Who was stuck in the floor?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	Diane crawled under the floor to try to fix the heating duct. However she got stuck and could not move forward or backward.

questions.text: How many eggs did Carla sell for a nickle?
questions.explanation:
3.

	Carla was selling eggs to hit Diane with while she was stuck under the floor. Carla didn't like Diane, just like she disliked Cliff.

Cliff.

	He could have been fired from his job for letting someone else deliver the mail. However, Cliff's record was spotless so they didn't fire him.

questions.text: Who said his whole identity was being a mailman?
questions.explanation:
Cliff.

	Cliff was very proud of his job as a mailman. He usually talked about it like it was the most important job there had ever been.

questions.text: Who did Cliff buy a beer?
questions.explanation:
Norm.

	Norm agreed to be friends with Cliff if he bought him a beer. He then added that he had to drop his pants around his ankles, stand on the bar stool and bark like a seal.
